content.heading: HTML id Attribute
paragraphs: The HTML id attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element. You cannot have more than one element with the same id in an HTML document.

content.heading: The id Attribute
paragraphs: The id attribute specifies a unique id for an HTML element. The value of the id attribute must be unique within the HTML document.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs: My Header

content.heading: Difference Between Class and ID
paragraphs: A class name can be used by multiple HTML elements, while an id name must only be used by one HTML element within the page.

content.heading: HTML Bookmarks with ID and Links
paragraphs: HTML bookmarks allow readers to jump to specific parts of a webpage. They can be useful if your page is very long.

content.heading: Using the id Attribute in JavaScript
paragraphs: The id attribute can be used by JavaScript to perform tasks for that specific element. JavaScript can access an element with a specific id using the getElementById() method.
